intro: Euryops arabicus, commonly known as the Arabian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a distinctive sunflower-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Euryops arabicus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
